title: E is the son of A. D is the son of B. E is married to C. C is B's daughter. How is D related to E? - Quora

response.answer_text: If E is the son of A, we can consider A as a very different person. Then comes D who is B's son and it is even noted that C is B's daughter. So it's very clear that C and D are kids of B. Then E is married to C. So accordingly, I conclude that D is E's brother in law as D is C's brother
Here C is B's daughter… 1 D is son of B…. 2 From 1 and 2,we get D brother of C…. 3 Also C is wife of E…. 4 From 3 and 4,we get D is brother-in-law of E
